forumNotes.author: Mesh
forumNotes.content:
Backtrack 3 was unable to access the same external harddisk because of wrong configuration

the wrong configuration of menu.lst for backtrack 3 sections was ``` title BackTrack root (hd0,0) kernel /boot/vmlinuz max_loop=255 initrd=initrd.gz init=linuxrc load_ramdisk=1 prompt_ramdisk=0 ramdisk_size=6666 root=/dev/ram0 rw initrd /boot/initrd.gz boot ```
the Correct configuration of menu.lst for backtrack 3 sections is ``` title BT3 Graphics mode (KDE) root (hd0,1) kernel= /boot/vmlinuz ramdisk_size=6666 root=/dev/ram0 rw autoexec=xconf;kdm APPEND vga=0x317 initrd=/boot/initrd.gz boot ```

> So , Any one for the Fujitsu Simens Amilo Pi 1505 Problem ??

Probably there is nothing to do, it seems like a "bad" BIOS.  

You can try using the Hp's utility (or however the Win2k/XP/2003 modified MBR):  
[http://www.boot-land...opic=2246\&st=15](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=2246&st=15 "External link")  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=3191](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=3191 "External link")  
and load grldr through NTLDR/BOOT.INI  

But I do not think it will make a difference, it sounds like a BIOS mapping the external drive as non-HD device (maybe superfloppy? ![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif))  

jaclaz
